guest_signals: Asks for the ‘best’ trim, standout design, premium feel, or status features.
on_lot_handles: Start with top-trim walkaround cues (design, materials, tech). Confirm what ‘premium’ means to them.
demo_60_seconds: Show 1 exterior presence cue + 1 interior materials/tech cue + 1 convenience feature they’ll use daily.
translate_line: “This trim is designed to feel premium every time you get in — it’s the one that makes the biggest impression.”
invite_next_step: “If we can get this exact trim in the color you want, are you ready to move forward today?”
coach_roleplay_prompt: Practice turning a ‘Why is this more?’ question into a benefits-first explanation tied to premium feel.
compliance_note: Avoid quoting MPG/ratings unless verified on the window sticker/spec sheet. Feature availability varies by trim/package—confirm on the unit in front of you.

guest_signals: Wants a simple process, hates pressure, values flexibility and control over the decision.
on_lot_handles: Offer 2 clear options and let them choose the path (features vs payment vs availability).
demo_60_seconds: Demonstrate ease-of-use: phone pairing, driver settings, and one ‘friction remover’ feature.
translate_line: “This is the trim that keeps things straightforward — it gives you control without the extra noise.”
invite_next_step: “Which direction do you want to go: best value, most convenience, or quickest availability?”
coach_roleplay_prompt: Practice giving two options and pausing (no over-talking) so the guest stays in control.
compliance_note: Avoid quoting MPG/ratings unless verified on the window sticker/spec sheet. Feature availability varies by trim/package—confirm on the unit in front of you.

guest_signals: Compares trims, asks for data, wants ‘smart value’ and long-term cost clarity.
on_lot_handles: Use a simple value ladder: base value → key upgrade → best overall value. Keep it factual.
demo_60_seconds: Show the ‘value delta’ feature: the one upgrade that clearly justifies stepping up (or staying put).
translate_line: “If you’re making the smart decision, this trim gives you the best return for what you actually use.”
invite_next_step: “Want to compare these two trims side-by-side on price and key features?”
coach_roleplay_prompt: Practice answering ‘What’s the difference?’ with 3 bullets: safety, comfort, tech (verified).
compliance_note: Avoid quoting MPG/ratings unless verified on the window sticker/spec sheet. Feature availability varies by trim/package—confirm on the unit in front of you.

guest_signals: Mentions family safety, weather, reliability, driver-assist, or ‘peace of mind.’
on_lot_handles: Confirm their safety priorities, then demonstrate the confidence features that match.
demo_60_seconds: Show driver-assist basics + visibility + one stability/traction story relevant to local roads.
translate_line: “This trim is built to help you feel confident — it’s about peace of mind on every drive.”
invite_next_step: “If this meets your safety checklist, should we lock in the exact one you want?”
coach_roleplay_prompt: Practice explaining driver-assist as ‘support’ (not autonomous driving) and confirming expectations.
compliance_note: Avoid quoting MPG/ratings unless verified on the window sticker/spec sheet. Feature availability varies by trim/package—confirm on the unit in front of you.

guest_signals: Wants performance, style, ‘fun factor,’ rugged look, or a trim that feels exciting.
on_lot_handles: Lean into emotional benefits: look, feel, and capability. Tie features to lifestyle.
demo_60_seconds: Show 1 design cue + 1 performance/capability cue + 1 ‘wow’ tech feature.
translate_line: “This is the trim that feels like a reward — it’s the one you’ll be excited to drive.”
invite_next_step: “If this is the one that makes you smile, want to take it for a quick drive right now?”
coach_roleplay_prompt: Practice converting ‘I want the sporty one’ into a tight feature story + next step.
compliance_note: Avoid quoting MPG/ratings unless verified on the window sticker/spec sheet. Feature availability varies by trim/package—confirm on the unit in front of you.

guest_signals: Talks about family/friends, comfort for passengers, space, and shared experiences.
on_lot_handles: Seat them where they’ll ride most. Show comfort/space and the ‘together’ features.
demo_60_seconds: Demonstrate passenger comfort: second-row access, storage, and a shared-tech feature.
translate_line: “This trim is about making everyone comfortable — it’s designed for the people riding with you.”
invite_next_step: “Want to sit in both seating layouts so you can feel the difference?”
coach_roleplay_prompt: Practice framing features as ‘how your family uses it’ rather than listing specs.
compliance_note: Avoid quoting MPG/ratings unless verified on the window sticker/spec sheet. Feature availability varies by trim/package—confirm on the unit in front of you.

translate_line: “This trim is built to help you feel confident — it’s about peace of mind on every drive.”
invite_next_step: “If this meets your safety checklist, should we lock in the exact one you want?”
coach_roleplay_prompt: Practice explaining driver-assist as ‘support’ (not autonomous driving) and confirming expectations.
compliance_note: Avoid quoting MPG/ratings unless verified on the window sticker/spec sheet. Feature availability varies by trim/package—confirm on the unit in front of you.

guest_signals: Wants performance, style, ‘fun factor,’ rugged look, or a trim that feels exciting.
on_lot_handles: Lean into emotional benefits: look, feel, and capability. Tie features to lifestyle.
demo_60_seconds: Show 1 design cue + 1 performance/capability cue + 1 ‘wow’ tech feature.
translate_line: “This is the trim that feels like a reward — it’s the one you’ll be excited to drive.”
invite_next_step: “If this is the one that makes you smile, want to take it for a quick drive right now?”
coach_roleplay_prompt: Practice converting ‘I want the sporty one’ into a tight feature story + next step.
compliance_note: Avoid quoting MPG/ratings unless verified on the window sticker/spec sheet. Feature availability varies by trim/package—confirm on the unit in front of you.

guest_signals: Talks about family/friends, comfort for passengers, space, and shared experiences.
on_lot_handles: Seat them where they’ll ride most. Show comfort/space and the ‘together’ features.
demo_60_seconds: Demonstrate passenger comfort: second-row access, storage, and a shared-tech feature.
translate_line: “This trim is about making everyone comfortable — it’s designed for the people riding with you.”
invite_next_step: “Want to sit in both seating layouts so you can feel the difference?”
coach_roleplay_prompt: Practice framing features as ‘how your family uses it’ rather than listing specs.
compliance_note: Avoid quoting MPG/ratings unless verified on the window sticker/spec sheet. Feature availability varies by trim/package—confirm on the unit in front of you.

guest_signals: Asks for the ‘best’ trim, standout design, premium feel, or status features.
on_lot_handles: Start with top-trim walkaround cues (design, materials, tech). Confirm what ‘premium’ means to them.
demo_60_seconds: Show 1 exterior presence cue + 1 interior materials/tech cue + 1 convenience feature they’ll use daily.
translate_line: “This trim is designed to feel premium every time you get in — it’s the one that makes the biggest impression.”
invite_next_step: “If we can get this exact trim in the color you want, are you ready to move forward today?”
coach_roleplay_prompt: Practice turning a ‘Why is this more?’ question into a benefits-first explanation tied to premium feel.
compliance_note: Avoid quoting MPG/ratings unless verified on the window sticker/spec sheet. Feature availability varies by trim/package—confirm on the unit in front of you.

guest_signals: Wants a simple process, hates pressure, values flexibility and control over the decision.
on_lot_handles: Offer 2 clear options and let them choose the path (features vs payment vs availability).
demo_60_seconds: Demonstrate ease-of-use: phone pairing, driver settings, and one ‘friction remover’ feature.
translate_line: “This is the trim that keeps things straightforward — it gives you control without the extra noise.”
invite_next_step: “Which direction do you want to go: best value, most convenience, or quickest availability?”
coach_roleplay_prompt: Practice giving two options and pausing (no over-talking) so the guest stays in control.
compliance_note: Avoid quoting MPG/ratings unless verified on the window sticker/spec sheet. Feature availability varies by trim/package—confirm on the unit in front of you.

guest_signals: Compares trims, asks for data, wants ‘smart value’ and long-term cost clarity.
on_lot_handles: Use a simple value ladder: base value → key upgrade → best overall value. Keep it factual.
demo_60_seconds: Show the ‘value delta’ feature: the one upgrade that clearly justifies stepping up (or staying put).
translate_line: “If you’re making the smart decision, this trim gives you the best return for what you actually use.”
invite_next_step: “Want to compare these two trims side-by-side on price and key features?”
coach_roleplay_prompt: Practice answering ‘What’s the difference?’ with 3 bullets: safety, comfort, tech (verified).
compliance_note: Avoid quoting MPG/ratings unless verified on the window sticker/spec sheet. Feature availability varies by trim/package—confirm on the unit in front of you.
